gov.nasa.jpf.util

Class DynamicIntArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.jpf.util.DynamicIntArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Integer>

    public final class DynamicIntArray
extends Object
implements Iterable<Integer>
    simplistic dynamic array that differentiates from ArrayList by - using chunks instead of exponential growth, thus efficiently dealing with sparse arrays - managing primitive 'int' types, i.e. not requiring box objects the motivation for this class is memory optimization, i.e. space efficient storage of potentially huge arrays without good a-priori size guesses the API of this class is between a primitive array and a AbstractList. It's not a Collection implementation because it handles primitive types, but the API could be extended to support iterators and the like. NOTE: like standard Collection implementations/arrays, this class is not synchronized

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DynamicIntArray() 
      DynamicIntArray(Growth strategy, int chunkBits, int initChunks) 
      DynamicIntArray(int size) 
      DynamicIntArray(int chunkBits, int initChunks)
      Creates a DynamicIntArray in which each chunk has 2**chunkBits elements and initChunks chunks are initially allocated.
